result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew X. Winters

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew X. Winters in court, in custody.  Attorney David E. Celebre in court for Matthew X. Winters.  Prosecuting attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes:  Case heard with 22CF1319 prelim hrg today.  Not guilty plea previously entered.   Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. 
*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  Strict compliance with vivitrol program

203PM
Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am. $1000 Cash Bond Set w/ continued conditions (see bond entry). ec
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.
Warrant sent to JS

Attorney David E. Celebre in court for Matthew X. Winters.  Attorney Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HMcBride.  Defendant Matthew X. Winters not in court. Court issues BW and forfeits bond.

Prior: Homeless, Homeless,
Amended:   *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  Strict compliance with vivitrol program.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Celebre.   Clerk HMcBride.   Bond motion filed in 22CF557.   DE has been approved for the vivitrol program and eligible as of today. Atty Celebre requests SB or $400 CB.  State objects.  Court hears argument.   Court modifies bond to $400 CB - same conditions with additional condition: Strict compliance with vivitrol program.  Court will review in three weeks.   RH 9/14 1:30pm.
to Modify Bond and Supporting Affidavit filed by Atty Celebre - 8/24 930am

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Celebre.   Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Celebre requests adjmt. DE has new case and he needs to meet with DE in person.  Adjmt granted. PTC 8/24 930am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Celebre.    Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Celebre requests adjmt for DE to become enrolled in programming.  Granted.  PTC 7/18 2pm. Bond continued.

Defendant Matthew X. Winters appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KSD Dep Keith Kirwan; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Celebre. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Branch 1 Scheduling Order given to attorney.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty David Celebre
